articles.headline: Hate Vista? You May Like the Fix
articles.snippet: Forget Windows Vista. Its successor, called Windows 7, is almost here, and Microsoft is doing what it can to address Vista’s deficiencies.
articles.abstract: Forget Windows Vista. Its successor, called Windows 7, is almost here, and Microsoft is doing what it can to address Vista’s deficiencies.
articles.lead_paragraph: For an operating system that took five years to create, Windows Vista’s reputation went down in flames amazingly quickly. Not since Microsoft Bob has anything from the software giant drawn so much contempt and derision. Not every company lives to see the day when its customers beg, plead and sign petitions to bring back the previous version of its flagship product.

articles.headline: Apple Reports Strong First Quarter
articles.snippet: Apple said robust sales of the iPhone and its MacBook laptops buoyed the company amid a terrible holiday shopping season.
articles.abstract: Apple said robust sales of the iPhone and its MacBook laptops buoyed the company amid a terrible holiday shopping season.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Amid a deepening recession and an intensifying controversy over the health of its chief executive, Apple reported strong first-quarter profits on Wednesday that surprised analysts and handily beat Wall Street’s expectations.

articles.headline: Parsons Is Named Chairman of Citigroup
articles.snippet: The appointment will put to use Richard D. Parsons’s ties to the Obama administration as well as his experience in running companies under a federal microscope.
articles.abstract: The appointment will put to use Richard D. Parsons’s ties to the Obama administration as well as his experience in running companies under a federal microscope.
articles.lead_paragraph: Richard D. Parsons swatted down talk last November that he might become the chairman of Citigroup, the struggling financial giant. “I have every confidence that we have the right team on the field to pull this thing out,” Mr. Parsons, then chairman of Time Warner and a Citigroup director, said in an interview with CNBC.

articles.headline: Jobs Vanish as Exports Fall in Asia
articles.snippet: The global economic slump is spreading across Asia, where countries depend on manufacturing for a far greater share of economic output than Western countries do.
articles.abstract: The global economic slump is spreading across Asia, where countries depend on manufacturing for a far greater share of economic output than Western countries do.
articles.lead_paragraph: KARAWANG, Indonesia — At a three-story factory here that used to make television remote controls, most of the fluorescent lights have been turned off. The hallways are nearly silent, and three-quarters of the workers have been laid off.

articles.headline: Taliban Fill NATO’s Big Gaps in Afghan South
articles.snippet: The American-led coalition appears to have ceded much of the Afghan countryside to the Taliban, because it lacks sufficient forces to confront them.
articles.abstract: The American-led coalition appears to have ceded much of the Afghan countryside to the Taliban, because it lacks sufficient forces to confront them.
articles.lead_paragraph: TSAPOWZAI, Afghanistan  The Taliban are everywhere the soldiers are not, the saying goes in the southern part of the country.

articles.headline: Falling Pound Raises Fears of Stagnation
articles.snippet: From housing prices to banks, perspectives for the British economy seem bleaker than those of the U.S. or Europe.
articles.abstract: From housing prices to banks, perspectives for the British economy seem bleaker than those of the U.S. or Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — An island nation that bulked up on debt and lived beyond its means. A plunging currency. And a financial system edging toward nationalization.
articles.byline: By Julia Werdigier and Nelson D. Schwartz

articles.headline: How Green Is My Orange?
articles.snippet: PepsiCo calculated that the equivalent of 3.75 pounds of carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere for each half-gallon carton of orange juice.
articles.abstract: PepsiCo calculated that the equivalent of 3.75 pounds of carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere for each half-gallon carton of orange juice.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRADENTON, Fla.  How much does your morning glass of orange juice contribute to global warming?

articles.headline: On First Day, Obama Quickly Sets a New Tone
articles.snippet: President Obama moved to impose new rules on government transparency, calling it “a clean break from business as usual.”
articles.abstract: President Obama moved to impose new rules on government transparency, calling it “a clean break from business as usual.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama moved swiftly on Wednesday to impose new rules on government transparency and ethics, using his first full day in office to freeze the salaries of his senior aides, mandate new limits on lobbyists and demand that the government disclose more information.

articles.headline: Obama Issues Directive to Shut Down Guantánamo
articles.snippet: President Obama on Thursday signed orders shutting the network of secret prisons and closing the Guantánamo detention camp within a year.
articles.abstract: President Obama on Thursday signed orders shutting the network of secret prisons and closing the Guantánamo detention camp within a year.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  President Obama signed executive orders Thursday directing the Central Intelligence Agency to shut what remains of its network of secret prisons and ordering the closing of the Guantánamo detention camp within a year, government officials said.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and William Glaberson

articles.headline: I Really Do Swear, Faithfully: Obama and Roberts Try Again
articles.snippet: Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. re-administered the oath to President Obama a day after they stumbled over the words.
articles.abstract: Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. re-administered the oath to President Obama a day after they stumbled over the words.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  In 25 seconds, President Obama became president again.

articles.headline: Microsoft Slashes Jobs as Sales Fall
articles.snippet: With sales of PCs falling, Microsoft said it would lay off 5 percent of its work force, and warned that technology spending could wane for years to come.
articles.abstract: With sales of PCs falling, Microsoft said it would lay off 5 percent of its work force, and warned that technology spending could wane for years to come.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. — With sales of computers deteriorating by the day, the PC industry’s dominant players — Microsoft and Intel — have arrived at the stark realization that the slump in sales could last a long time, perhaps years.
